short_summary: Providing regular maintenance services for fire protection and life safety operations in various regions across Canada
description: The contractor will provide maintenance and repair services for fire protection systems and equipment, including inspections, testing, and maintenance of completed inspections. The contract will cover various regions across Canada, including Atlantic, Quebec, Ontario, Prairies, Alberta, Northwest Territories, and British Columbia. The contractor will be responsible for submitting bids for each region, and the department will award up to six contracts based on the highest bidder.
full_summary:
**Supplemental Maintenance Program - Code Compliance Inspections, Testing and Maintenance - Fire Protection and Life Safety – Parks Canada Agency**

**Government Tender Announcement**
 
The Parks Canada Agency invites qualified contractors to submit a bid for the supplemental maintenance program, including code compliance inspections, testing and maintenance of fire protection and life safety systems, across various regions.

**Bid Submission Requirements**
 
Bids must be submitted via email to soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca. Fax submissions will also be accepted through 1-866-246-6893. In-person and courier submissions will not be accepted. Please note that the maximum email file size is 15 megabytes. 

**Solicited Services**
 
The successful bidder will be responsible for conducting inspections, testing and maintenance of fire protection and life safety systems, as identified in Appendix 1, in accordance with the most recent edition of the National Model Codes and applicable Standards. The bidder must ensure certification of such inspection.

**Contract Duration**
 
The contract period will be from the contract commencement date to February 29, 2024, inclusive. 

**Number of Contracts**
 
Parks Canada intends to award up to six (6) contracts from this solicitation process, one for each of the following regions: Atlantic, Quebec, Ontario and Waterways, Prairies, Alberta and Northwest Territories, and British Columbia.

**Contract Selection**
 
The successful bidder will be selected based on the lowest price. Bidders may submit a bid for any or all regions but must submit complete Financial and Technical bids for each region of their bid.

**Enquiries**
 
All enquiries of a technical and contractual nature should be submitted to the Contracting Authority. Enquiries must be received no later than seven (7) calendar days prior to the contract closing date to allow sufficient time to reply.

**Procurement Details**
 
The procurement process is made available in both English and French on the Government of Canada's tendering service (https://canadabuys.canada.ca). Documents may be submitted in either official language.

Note that the Parks Canada Agency has made every effort to provide equivalent documents in both official languages. However, differences may arise; please notify the contract officer if discrepancies are found.

By participating in this tender, contractors agree to work in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

The Government of Canada reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Only complete and compliant submissions will be considered for award. 

Please contact Andrea
